intro: Cyphostemma descoingsii, commonly known as the African moon vine, is a climbing plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its long, trailing stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces distinctive, bead-like fruits that contain seeds covered in a silky, white coating. It thrives in well-drained soils and requires full sun to partial shade, making it suitable for arid and semi-arid environments. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
